title: George Owens (rugby)
text:
George Owens (26 Nov 1894 – Dec 1978), also known by the nickname of 'Dodger', was a Welsh <a href="rugby%20union">rugby union</a>, and professional <a href="rugby%20league">rugby league</a> footballer who played in the 1910s and 1920s. He played club level rugby union (RU) for <a href="Swansea%20RFC">Swansea RFC</a>, and representative level rugby league (RL) for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a>, and at club level for <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a> and later <a href="St%20Helens%20R.F.C.">St Helens</a> (Jan-Mar 1928), as a , i.e. number 6.
Playing career.
Change of code.
Following a meeting with a Wigan rugby league club representative at the Bush Hotel, <a href="Swansea">Swansea</a> on Sunday 28 September 1913, <a href="Swansea%20RFC">Swansea RFC</a>'s rugby union <a href="Rugby%20union%20positions%23Half-backs">half-back</a> pairing of <a href="Sidney%20Jerram">Sidney Jerram</a>, and George Owens were each signed for £180 down payment (based on increases in average earnings, this would be approximately £61,630 in 2013), guaranteed win bonuses, and jobs for £2 per week cash.
International honours.
George Owens won a <a href="Cap%20%28sport%29">cap</a> for <a href="Wales%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">Wales</a> (RL) while at Wigan in 1923.
Championship Final appearances.
George Owens played , in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 22–10 victory over <a href="Warrington%20Wolves">Warrington</a> in the <a href="Rugby%20Football%20League%20Championship">Championship</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="Knowsley%20Road">Knowsley Road</a>, <a href="St%20Helens%2C%20Merseyside">St. Helens</a> on Saturday 8 May 1926.
County League appearances.
George Owens played in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s victories in the <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20League">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20leagues">County League</a> during the <a href="1913%E2%80%9314%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1913–14 season</a>, <a href="1914%E2%80%9315%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1914–15 season</a>, <a href="1920%E2%80%9321%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20Union%20season">1920–21 season</a>, <a href="1922%E2%80%9323%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1922–23 season</a>, <a href="1923%E2%80%9324%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1923–24 season</a> and <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a>.
County Cup Final appearances.
George Owens played , in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 20–2 victory over <a href="Leigh%20Centurions">Leigh</a> in the <a href="1922%E2%80%9323%20Lancashire%20Cup">1922–23</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1922%E2%80%9323%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1922–23 season</a> at <a href="The%20Willows%2C%20Salford">The Willows, Salford</a> on Saturday 25 November 1922, and played in the 11–15 defeat by <a href="Swinton%20Lions">Swinton</a> in the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Lancashire%20Cup">1925–26</a> <a href="RFL%20Lancashire%20Cup">Lancashire</a> <a href="Rugby%20league%20county%20cups">County Cup</a> Final during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="The%20Cliff%20%28training%20ground%29">The Cliff</a>, <a href="Broughton%2C%20Salford">Broughton</a> on Wednesday 9 December 1925.
Notable tour matches.
George Owens played , in <a href="Wigan%20Warriors">Wigan</a>'s 36–15 victory over <a href="New%20Zealand%20national%20rugby%20league%20team">New Zealand</a> in the tour match during the <a href="1925%E2%80%9326%20Northern%20Rugby%20Football%20League%20season">1925–26 season</a> at <a href="Central%20Park%20%28Wigan%29">Central Park</a>, <a href="Wigan">Wigan</a> on Saturday 11 December 1926.
